paper: PredNext_ Explicit Cross-View Temporal Prediction for Unsupervised Learning in Spiking Neural Networks

differences.summary: Loss scaling/weighting and notation inconsistencies introduced

evidence.final_quote: Algorithm 1 defines L_pred with a global 0.25 scaling

differences.why_impacts_score: casts doubt on correctness of reported consistency results

evidence.final_quote: Table 4 reports “consistency” values that increase with larger β...

differences.summary: Stronger pushback on ‘comparable to supervised’ claim with lower numbers
differences.why_impacts_score: overclaiming diminishes credibility of performance claims

evidence.baseline_quote: best PredNext without ImageNet init is ~59.76–62.75 ... non-trivial gap.
evidence.final_quote: best PredNext without ImageNet init is ~59.76–61.06 ... non-trivial gap.

differences.summary: Lower technical quality score citing new inconsistencies
differences.why_impacts_score: explicit rationale links contradictions to reduced technical rigor

evidence.baseline_quote: Technical Quality (10): 7 — Solid experiments; missing linear probes, efficiency metrics, neuron parameters, and variance.
evidence.final_quote: Technical Quality (10): 6 — inconsistencies in loss scaling and metric labeling; missing linear probes and variance reduce rigor.

differences.summary: Adjusted improvement magnitude for SimCLR (smaller gain reported)
differences.why_impacts_score: reduces perceived effect size of improvements
